alert.note: Alert for Crittenden; Cross (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 21 at 5:13AM CDT until April 22 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of East Arkansas, including the following counties, Crittenden, Cross and St. Francis. * WHEN...Until 700 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 511 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rainfall will be possible in as little as an hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Forrest City, Wynne, Earle, Hughes, Parkin, Madison, Palestine, Village Creek State Park, Caldwell, Edmondson, and Colt.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
